readability_reflection: I prefer using the '+' string concatenation. I think the interpolation looks nicer syntax-wise, but the one that makes the most sense to me in terms of reading and understanding is the basic string concatenation. For example " {1} {2}" and 1 + 2, would sometimes confuse me in a string because the {1} {2} feels like it should be another variable
comprehension_debugging: Yes, I think it took me a bit longer to read and understand using interpolation. Especially with other brackets, it became difficult to read.
preference_rationale: I would choose string concatenation. I feel that the simpler it looks, as long as I understand when I'm working with strings versus integers or numbers, it is really simple to read.
learning_curve: Since I am so used to string concatenation already, this may make my opinion biased on interpolation, as I barely used nor was taught it. But, string concatenation made the most sense to me logically.
suggestions_improvement: I think the simplicity of string concatenation makes it intuitive and easy to understand. I don't know if either could necessarily be "improved" as both have their advantages and disadvantages, which is all up to preference in its usage.
